name: Rejecting an ambiguous update
description:
To protect data consistency and the user experience,
  the system should clearly communicate errors and block invalid operations.
descriptionHtml:
To protect data consistency and the user experience,
the system should clearly communicate errors and block invalid operations.
statusMessage: Expected one of [BAD_REQUEST (400), CONFLICT (409), UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY (422)], but was OK (200)
statusTrace:
java.lang.AssertionError: Expected one of [BAD_REQUEST (400), CONFLICT (409), UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY (422)], but was OK (200)
	at eu.delimata.bookstore.support.ResponseAssert.assertHttpStatusCode(ResponseAssert.java:50)
	at eu.delimata.bookstore.stepdefinitions.BooksSteps.updateRejectedWithGuidance(BooksSteps.java:212)
	at ✽.the update of book is rejected with guidance on how to correctly specify the item to change(classpath:eu/delimata/bookstore/books-negative.feature:35)

steps.name: Given I have valid permissions to manage the bookstore

When I attempt to update the book in an ambiguous or inconsistent way
